titleproper.value:
Guide to the New-York Historical Society Collection of Ships and Shipping Records
                    <lb/>1660-1943
                    <lb/>
                    <num>MS 563</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Alison Barr and Larry Weimer

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2017-07-24T11:23-0400</date>

unittitle.value: New-York Historical Society collection of ships and shipping records

extent.value:
in two document boxes, one oversize flat box, 
and one oversize folder

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value:
The collection includes a wide variety of documents compiled around a loosely-defined thematic connection to ships and shipping. Roughly 175 ships are represented in the collection, though often with just one document. Documents include bills of lading; invoices, receipts, account statements, and other financial papers; passes for ships; cargo manifests; depositions and other statements; sailing instructions and agreements; records of prizes won from captured ships; logbooks; crew lists; insurance policies; import certifications; and others. The collection also ranges widely over time, from a 1660-1663 journal (in Dutch) kept aboard the ships 
                <emph render="italic">Golden Beaver</emph> and 
                <emph render="italic">Golden Otter</emph> to a 1942 transcript concerning a fire aboard the S.S. 
                <emph render="italic">Normandie</emph> at New York’s Pier 88.

p.value: Open to qualified researchers. Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)
This collection should be cited as the New-York Historical Society collection of ships and shipping records, MS 563, New-York Historical Society.

The collection as a whole was compiled over time by New-York Historical Society from various donations and purchases, though the specific source is unknown for many of the items. When the source is known, it is noted at the folder level.

Despite the random nature of the collection and the lack of deep documentation for most ships, there are several folders that include particularly rich materials. These include, for example, the papers of the sloop 
                <emph render="italic">Experiment</emph> (1785-1787), which document in detail the outfitting of the ship for a voyage from New York to Canton and back, along with payments to crew (portage bill), articles of association among its investors, and the eventual sale of the sloop and distribution of the proceeds. As another example, a folder includes the articles of association, stock certificates and other corporate documents concerning the Schuyler Steam Tow Boat Line and the Express Propeller Line (1847-1881). Although most ships are represented by only one or a few documents, these are often very rich documents, including an account of a British military expedition to the West Indies aboard the 
                <emph render="italic">Boyne</emph> (1793-1794); signals to be used by the convoy of the 
                <emph render="italic">Roman Emperor</emph> (1760s?); prize roll of the officers and seamen of the 
                <emph render="italic">Constellation</emph> after the capture of the French frigate 
                <emph render="italic">L'Insurgente</emph> (1799); logbook of the master of the 
                <emph render="italic">Amphion</emph> on a voyage from New York to Montevideo (1820); the descriptive muster roll of the steamship 
                <emph render="italic">General Grant</emph> (1864); morning reports of the prisoners in the brig of the 
                <emph render="italic">St. Paul</emph> (1898); and orchestra programs and a captioned photograph of the band on the flagship 
                <emph render="italic">Kentucky</emph> (1901-1904). Given the diverse nature of the materials in the collection, detailed scope notes are provided for each folder in the container list.

dsc.value:
Sloop Admiral Duncan. Oversize Oversize - Small - 1803 Scope and Contents note

Proclamation by John Halkett, Esquire (Bahama Islands) that Sloop Admiral Duncan is fitted, armed and sent out upon a cruise against the King's enemies. (Gift from Gertrude Harrison, Elizabeth Harrison and William Harrison, 16 June 1936.)

 Ship Adriana 1 1 1788-1793 Scope and Contents note

Invoices: Andrew Clow & Co., John Robertson, Sam Chubbard, Messrs. Rathbone & Benson, Ralph Pearson, Thomas Barlow, Thomas Porter, B. Gressham, Joseph Rider, Estate of Andrew Clow. Bills of Lading. Bills for boarding (Capt. Robertson of new Ship Adriana). Trademen's Bills. Account Statements of Andrew Clow & Co. Pay bearer, Captain John Robertson, Messrs. Rathbone & Benson. Advance to John Grant. Freight List. Discharge by David Cay, surviving partner of Andrew Clow & Co. (Gift of Diane R. Schneider, 4 June 1975.)

 Ship Albany 1 2 1736-1743 Scope and Contents note

Receipts, Capt. James Clark. Agreement between Master James Clark and seamen, Voyage to Jamaica Bay, Hondorus, Amsterdam, New York. Order to sail, Capt. James Clark. Current account statement to Owners of Ship Albany. Sale of Ship Albany, Samuel Storke, proceeds. Memorandum re Ship Albany and Storke's breach of agreement. Henry Cuyler, Defense of 1/3 of the Ship Albany. Correspondence, Messrs. Cuyler & Livingston, Sam Storke, James Alexander (London), Daniel Crommelin (Amsterdam), Messrs. Widdow Albertus & John Hudshons, Charles Handly (New York)

 Revenue Cutter Alert 1 3 1838 Scope and Contents note

Weekly abstract from the Journal of the U.S. Revenue Cutter Alert, Nicholas Bicka, Esq. Commander. (Gift from Robert Fridenburg, 1 July 1933.)

 Ship Alert. Oversize Oversize - Small - 1812 Scope and Contents note

Ship Alert's Passport. Certificate that Ship Alert, Isaiah Eldridge, master, has no guns and may pass, owned by citizens of the United States. Contains presidential signature. (Gift from Samuel V. Hoffman, 22 November 1924.)

 Schooner Alert. Oversize Oversize - Small - 1809 Scope and Contents note

Schooner Alert's Passport. Certificate that Schooner Alert, Alyn Muther, master, has four guns and may pass, owned by citizens of the United States. Contains presidential signature. (Gift from Samuel V. Hoffman, 24 January 1925.)

 Sloop America 1 4 1813 Scope and Contents note

Bill of Lading. (Gift from C.K. Johnson, 14 December 1940.)

 Ship Amphion 1 5 1820 Scope and Contents note

Logbook, Stephen Smith, Master. New York to Monte Video. (Gift of Mary C. Du Bois, 7 August 1933.)

 Sloop Anna Maria 1 6 1817 Scope and Contents note

Invoice, Burnell Brown

 U.S. Steamer Arctic 1 7 1856 Scope and Contents note

Abstract of Log of U.S.S. Arctic. Sounding across Telegraphic Plateau from Trinity Bay to S.C. of Ireland. (Gift of N.D., 1 December 1966.)

 U.S. Brig. Bainbridge 1 8 1843 Scope and Contents note

Dimensions of sails. Outfits in the Gunners Dept., Boston.

 Ship Baltic 1 9 1811 Scope and Contents note

Registration of Ship, Master James Eaken. (Gift from Charles F. Jenkins, 20 January 1926.)

 Brig. Beta 1 10 1834 Scope and Contents note

Account of Mr. J.A. Cleveland; Sales of silks and teas received ex Brig Beta, Master W. Cleveland

 Sloop Betsy 1 11 1783 Scope and Contents note

Policy of Insurance for Sloop Betsy, Master Abraham Gurling, Philadelphia. (Gift of Cyrus Curtis, 19 June 1875.)

 Ship Boyne 1 12 1793 - 1794 Scope and Contents note

List of the general, field, and staff officers of the Army in the West Indies, under General Sir Charles Grey, Journal commencing 19 November 1793 when Grey left London on the Boyne (logbook of conquest of Pigeon Island). (Gift from the estate of Augustus van Cortlandt van Rensselaer, care of Florence van Rensselaer, 8 June 1954.)

 Steamboat Bunker Hill 1 13 1836 Scope and Contents note

Freight Bill

 Brig. Calliope 1 14 1792 Scope and Contents note

Power of Attorney of Francis Anderson, cooper, to wife, Jane Anderson while aboard Brig Calliope, Captain Thomas Snell

 Ship Charles Carroll 1 15 1831 Scope and Contents note

Bill of lading, Hottinquer & Co. (Gift from Harrold E. Gillingham, 18 January 1936.)

 Sloop Charming Peggy 1 16 1770 Scope and Contents note

Certificate for a ship that gives Bond in the Plantations, and loads Rum or Spirits, not to land the same in the Isle of Man; Peregrine Van Emburgh, Master

 Armed Boat Chatham 1 17 1776 Scope and Contents note

John Christie's order to release James Wood from Work House

 Brig. Chauncey. Oversize Oversize - Small - 1820 Scope and Contents note

Brig Chauncey's Passport. Certificate that Brig Chauncey, Richard Cok, master, has no guns and may pass, owned by citizens of the United States. Contains presidential signatures. (Gift from Samuel V. Hoffman, 22 November 1924.)

 S.S. Claribe 1 18 1881 Scope and Contents note

Certificate of Discharge for Gardiner Stewart. (Gift of Mrs. Gardiner Stewart, February 1950.)

 Schooner Commerce 1 19 1842 Scope and Contents note

Bills of lading, E.B. Clayton, Master Krag

 U.S.F. Constellation. Oversize Oversize - Small - 1799 Scope and Contents note

Prize roll of the officers and seamen after the capture of the French Frigate L'Insurgente, February 09, 1799. Subscribers' Acknowledgement of prize money received of Henry Bainbridge by hand of Charles Biddle for the French Frigate L'Insurgente. Purser's receipt of prize money for French Frigate L'Insurgente. Assignments of annexed certificate (assignments of prize money)

 U.S.F. Constellation 1 20 1842 Scope and Contents note

Correspondence of G.A. Denniston to mother describing a confrontation witt the native inhabitants of Ceicer de Mer in the South China Sea. (Gift of Marie Will through the Chicago Historical Society, 15 November 1986.)

 U.S.F. Constitution 1 21 1814 Scope and Contents note

Receipt Book - N2, William M. Hunter

 Sloop Content 1 22 1694 Scope and Contents note

Certificate of the Collector & Receiver of the Province of New York re rum import (broke) and condemnation of sloop

 Schooner Convention 1 23 1834 Scope and Contents note

License of vessel, Captain Roe Haviland. (Gift from Samuel V. Hoffman, 26 November 1923.)

 Galley Cornwall. Oversize Oversize - Medium - 1759 Scope and Contents note

Articles of Agreement between James Laroche (on behalf of owners) and David Ducumb (Captain) for 2nd Voyage to windward and gold coast, Africa; Crew List

 Schooner Decatur 1 24 1848 Scope and Contents note

Protest of Master Jonathan T. Morrill. (Purchased from Irving Levy, 23 April 1936.)

 Sloop Dolphin 1 25 1791 Scope and Contents note

Manifest of cargo bound for New York, James Hinsdale, Master. (Gift from Charles F. Jenkins, 1 May 1925.)

 Ship Dorset. Oversize Oversize - Small - 1738 Scope and Contents note

Warrant of Survey, Samuel Winterburn, Commander. (Gift of the American Numismatic Society, 27 May 1941.)

 Dutch Ships: Golden Beaver, Golden Otter 1 26 1660-1663 Scope and Contents note

Journal kept aboard the Ship Golden Beaver and Ship Golden Otter from the Manhattan to Patria and the return to the Manhattans (in Dutch, with English translation provided by Professor Kenneth Scott.)

 Schooner Eliza 1 27 1803 - 1804 Scope and Contents note

Agreement of voyage and wages, Master Anior Harker, voyage from Newbern, NC to New York and return. Agreement of voyage and wages, Master Mathias Attinson, voyage to Jamaica and return.

 Schooner Emily 1 28 1811 Scope and Contents note

Bill of lading, William W. Woodward, Philadelphia, Master Nathan Foster. (Gift from Samuel V. Hoffman (purchased from library of William P. Clyde)?, 20 May 1931.)

 BK. Emita 1 29 1898 - 1904 Scope and Contents note

Wharfage fee, Standard Oil Co. of NY (Devoe Works), Master E.H. Praz. Wharfage Fees, James D. Leary, Master W.E. Reemi.

 Schooner Expert 1 30 1718 Scope and Contents note

Expert's Cargo. Peter Henick's Memorandum of Protest and Notes.

 Sloop Experiment 1 31 1785 - 1787 Scope and Contents note

Voyage From New York to Canton, China, and back. Invoices: Henry Sheafe, William Nixson, Robert Dale, Stewart & Jones, Thomas Browne, Thomas Barry, Thomas Biggs, William Kippin, J. Shipprey, Alexander Robertson & Co., Stewart Dean, Peter Schermerhorn, William Bradford, Elias Nexsen, Jacob Vanderheyden, John Bogert, Joseph Shurtleff, Abraham Brincherhoff, Jacob Gerhart, David Holly, Joseph Rose, Isaac Jones, Glen & Bleeker, William Lowther, James Carter, Abraham Willson & Isaac Brincherhoff, Elias Kip, Richard Clark, George Warner, John Whelton, Joshua Jones. First Cost & Outfit of the Sloop Experiment - S. Dean Master. Articles of Agreement between Owners of the Sloop Experiment. Memorandum as to distribution of shares of Sloop Experiment. General account and final settlement of the Sloop Experiment. Disbursements. Bill of Sale of Sloop Experiment. Sales of the Sloop Experiment. Transaction at a meeting of the owners of Sloop Experiment. Sales at auction of Edward Laight and William Deasoil. Receipt of William Laight & Co the respective sums and all demands against Sloop Experiment, Master Stewart Dean. Agreement of voyage. Instruction from Owners to Captain Stewart Dean. Portage bill, including list of ship's crew (including an African-American), with wages advanced and due. Wharfage fees. Account statements. Cooper and carpenters' accounts. (Gift of Edward W. Laight, 10 April 1838. Edward was the son of William Laight, a stockholder and agent for the concern.)

 Ship Fair American 1 32 1799 - 1806 Scope and Contents note

Account Sales (damaged on voyage from Charleston); Hamburg, John C. Brevoor, Master.

 U.S. Schooner Ferret 1 33 1824 Scope and Contents note

List of Articles required by Commander D.G. Farragut, Esq.

 Ship Florida. Oversize Oversize - Small - 1823 Scope and Contents note

Ship Florida's Passport. Certificate that Ship Florida (of New York), James Wilson, master, has one gun and may pass, owned by citizens of the United States. Contains presidential signature. (Gift from Samuel V. Hoffman, 22 November 1924.)

 Brig. Forest. Oversize Oversize - Small - 1825 Scope and Contents note

Brig Forest's Passport. Certificate that Brig Forest (of New York), Henry Greenleaf, master, has one gun and may pass, owned by citizens of the United States. Contains presidential signature. (Gift from Samuel V. Hoffman, 22 November 1924.)

 Ship Fortitude. Oversize Oversize - Small - 1803 Scope and Contents note

Articles of Agreement between Hezekiah Pinkham, Master, and seamen; Crew list; Voyage from New York, Norfolk, ports in Europe, and return

 U.S. Steamer General Grant. Oversize Oversize - Medium - 1864 Scope and Contents note

Complete Descriptive Muster Roll of the Crew of the U.S. Steamer General Grant. (Purchased from C.K. Johnson, from the Naval History Fund, 15 November 1938.)

 Ship General Thomas 1 34 Undated Scope and Contents note

Names (and shares received) of Officers and Men on Board the General Thomas at the taking of the Schooner Eliza, John Hodge, Commander; at the taking of the Sloop Lark, Jonathan Laurence, Master; at the taking of the Sloop Black (?), John Farley, Master; at the taking of the Snow Hopewell; at the taking of the Sloop Success; at the taking of the Sloop Nancy

 Ship Gideon Barstow. Oversize Oversize - Small - 1832 Scope and Contents note

Ship Gideon Barstow's Passport. Certificate that Ship Gideon Barstow (of Rochester), N.C. Cary, master, has no guns and may pass, owned by citizens of the United States. Contains presidential signature. (Gift from Stuyvesant F. Morris, 3 March 1921.)

 Horseboat Golden Fleece 1 35 1818 Scope and Contents note

Blot Mem and Calculations Book

 H.M.S. Greyhound 1 36 1722 Scope and Contents note

Depositions of Aron Bogaert, of Henry Kip, and of William Boll concerning an affray and breach of the peace.

 Schooner Hamilton. Oversize Oversize - Small - 1807 Scope and Contents note

The Crew List of Schooner Hamilton, John Richards, Master for voyage bound for La Vera Cruz. (Purchased, with the Naval History Fund, 22 December 1944.)

 Sloop Harriet 1 37 1800 Scope and Contents note

Order of Recorder to sell Sloop Harriet. (Gift from Samuel V. Hoffman, 6 April 1927.)

 Sloop Hera 1 38 1806 Scope and Contents note

Correspondence/Bill of Lading of Collins and Perkins to Dr. Jedidiah Morse of Charlestown regarding a delivery of two bundles of books. (Gift from Samuel V. Hoffman (purchased from library of William P. Clyde)?, 20 May 1931.)

 Ship Hostor(?) 1 39 1698? Scope and Contents Note

Statement by surveyor Hungerford providing information against the ship.

 Sloop Huntress 1 40 1813 Scope and Contents note

Bill of Lading. (Gift from C.K. Johnson, 14 December 1940.)

 Sloop Industry 1 41 1795 Scope and Contents note

Manifest of Inward voyage to New Bedford, Elizar Hathaway, Master. (Gift of Cornelius von Erden Mitchell, 13 May 1940.)

 Schooner James 1 42 1812 Scope and Contents note

Depositions of James Nevers and of Mark Leighton relative to Schooner James

 Ship James Cropper 1 43 1822 Scope and Contents note

Petition of Passengers on board James Cropper bound for New York from Liverpool regarding quieting of bell. (Gift from Gertrude Harrison, Elizabeth Harrison and William Harrison, 16 June 1936.)

 Brig. James Wells 1 44 1809 Scope and Contents note

Depositions of Eliphabet Kingsbury and Abraham Cummings regarding vessel leaking. (Gift from Samuel V. Hoffman, 28 March 1923.)

 Brig. Jerome. Oversize Oversize - Small - 1824 Scope and Contents note

Brig Jerome's Passport. Certificate that Brig Jerome (of New York),George W. Lee, master, has no guns and may pass, owned by citizens of the United States. Contains Presidential signature. (Gift from Samuel V. Hoffman, 22 November 1924.)

 U.S. Flagship Kentucky 2 1 1901-1904 Scope and Contents note

Orchestra Programs on voyages; some contain menu on reverse side. 1902 photograph of U.S.F.S Kentucky band at morning colors, noting names and instruments played. (From the E.B. Child collection, February 1946.)

 Sloop Lark 2 2 1796 Scope and Contents note

Manifest of Cargo on board Sloop Lark, Master Chris Godfrey, bound from Providence to New York. (Gift from Charles F. Jenkins, 20 January 1926.)

 Ship Liberty 2 3 1803 Scope and Contents note

Receipts and other documents relating to Ship Liberty's business in France (many of the documents are in French). (Gift from A.E. Rueff, 26 May 1928.)

 Schooner Lonsdale 2 4 1803 Scope and Contents note

Bill of Lading. (Gift of Thomas Ollive Mabbott, 8 May 1942.)

 Cartel Schooner Lucy 2 5 1812 Scope and Contents note

List of Cabin Passengers and Servants and their Stores for Schooner Lucy, Absolam Savage, Master; List of Stores for Schooner Lucy; List of Stores of Mr. Robert Abbott and of Mr. Jasper Howe; Permission request for provisions for animals in stores.

 Schooner Mail 2 6 1851 Scope and Contents note

Bill of Lading. (Gift from Thomas Ollive Mabbott, 24 June 1938.)

 Sloop Marey 2 7 1813 Scope and Contents note

Bill of Lading. (Gift from C.K. Johnson, 14 December 1940.)

 Ship Martha, Oversize Oversize - Small - 1811 Scope and Contents note

Ship Martha's Passport. Certificate that Ship Martha (of New York), Laban Gardner, master, has no guns and may pass, owned by citizens of the United States. Contains Presidential signature. (Purchase, 15 November 1938.)

 Schooner Mary Ann 2 8 1808 Scope and Contents note

Certificate of Landing; Schooner Mary Ann, Master Joseph Tompkins.

 Sloop Mary and Elizabeth 2 9 1704 Scope and Contents note

Statement in the Suit over the Sale of Sloop Mary and Elizabeth by George Parker to William Griffiths. (Purchase)

 Sloop Matilda 2 10 1804 Scope and Contents note

Entry of merchandize exported by John Speyer on board Sloop Matilda, John Dodge, Master, for the Coast of Africa.

 Ship Milford 2 11 1789 Scope and Contents note

Return of Ship Milford, Captain Shaw from Newfoundland. (Gift from Charles F. Jenkins, 1 May 1925.)

 Brig. Minerva 2 12 1810 Scope and Contents note

Receipt of Captain Hilburn; Crew List

 Schooner N.W. Smith 2 13 1853 Scope and Contents note

Certification of the Port of Charleston that no Slave or person held to Service or Labor is concealed on board Schooner N.W. Smith, E.N. Smith, Master. (Gift from Clarence L. Lersner, 8 December 1944.)

 Ship Nancy 2 14 1769 Scope and Contents note

Bill of Lading; Ship Nancy, John Waddle, Master.

 Schooner Nathaniel Chase. Oversize Oversize - Small - 1861 Scope and Contents note

Crew List of Schooner Nathaniel Chase, David Doane, Master. (Gift from Chales F. Heartman, 6 July 1946.)

 Clipper Ship Neptune's Favorite 2 15 1861 Scope and Contents note

Bill of Lading for Clipper Ship Neptune's Favorite, Master Emmertin. (Gift from William A. Robbins, 14 May 1941.)

 Schooner New England 2 16 1830 Scope and Contents note

Clearance Certificate of the Port of Wilmington, NC for Schooner New England, Hiram Cutts, Master, bound for Havana. (Purchased from Charles F. Heartman, 19 May 1931.)

 Prize Ship New Hampshire. Oversize Oversize - Small - 1746 Scope and Contents note

Record of Capture of French Ship, Le Heron (now, New Hampshire), William Burt, Master, by English Ship Maremaid, Capt. Warwick Calmadge.

 Ship New Harliquin 2 17 1762 Scope and Contents Note

Account of Joseph Forman.

 Ship New York Packet. Oversize Oversize - Small - 1810 Scope and Contents note

Ship New York Packet's Passport. Certificate that Ship New York Packet (of New York), Timothy Clifton, master, has no guns and may pass, owned by citizens of the United States. Contains Presidential signature. (Gift from Samuel V. Hoffman, 24 January 1925.)

 S.S. Normandie 2 18 1942 Scope and Contents note

Transcript in the Matter of Five-Alarm Fire in the S.S. Normandie at Pier 88, North River, Manhattan, February 9, 1942 at 2:49 p.m. Before Thomas P. Brophy, Chief Fire Marshall -- Witness Testimony.

 Ship Ocean. Oversize Oversize - Small - 1809 Scope and Contents note

Ship Ocean's Passport. Certificate that Ship Ocean (of New York), Samuel Eaken, master, has no guns and may pass, owned by citizens of the United States. Contains Presidential signature. (Gift from Samuel V. Hoffman, 19 December 1923.)

 Sloop Olive 2 19 1760 Scope and Contents note

Insurance Policy for Sloop Olive, Master Edgerton on voyage from Surinham (Suriname) to New York or New London.

 Schooner Orders in Council 2 20 1812 Scope and Contents note

Journal of the Order in Council (A Letter of Marque, Privateer), John Howard, Master; Crew List.

 Steamboat Oregon 2 21 1845 Scope and Contents note

Correspondence of John H. Cornish to wife, Martha (c/o Col. Joseph E. Jenkins), describing traveling on the boat on the Hudson River.

 Bark Osprey 2 22 1863 Scope and Contents note

Outfitting book of Bark Osprey, Reuben W. Crop, master. (Gift of Katherine R. Rogers, 28 June 1955.)

 Ship Pacific 2 23 1812 Scope and Contents note

Passengers' Thank you note to Captain Stanton on their voyage from Liverpool to New York; Passenger List.

 Sloop Patience 2 24 1768 Scope and Contents note

Sundries Receipt for Sloop Patience, William Ward, Master.

 Steamship Philadelphia 2 25 1855 Scope and Contents note

Marine Protest, Case of the Steamship Philadelphia, Master Findlay Schenck, on a voyage from New Orleans to New York.

 Steamboat Pittston 2 26 1861 Scope and Contents note

Inspector's Certificate of Steamboat Pittston, William Murry, Master. (Gift from Samuel V. Hoffman, 11 February 1925.)

 Frigate Raby 2 27 1705 Scope and Contents note

Notice of Frigate Raby's voyage to Lisbon and her Majesty's Plantations and return when not detained by embargoes. (Gift from Samuel V. Hoffman, 16 October 1923.)

 Brig. Ranger. Oversize Oversize - Medium - 1831 Scope and Contents note

[Ottoman Turkish] Clearance of Brig Ranger and Captain Eldridge at Constantinople (in Arabic?).

 Schooner Regulator 2 28 1799, 1807 Scope and Contents note

Alien Passenger List on Board Schooner Regulator, Master James Allen, arrived at port of New York from Jamaica (1799). Account of Master Richard Adams of Schooner Regulator (1807).

 Brig. Reuben & Eliza. Oversize Oversize - Small - 1822 Scope and Contents note

Brig Reuben & Eliza's Passport. Certificate that Brig Reuben & Eliza (of New York), Charles Harris, master, has no guns and may pass, owned by citizens of the United States. Contains Presidential signature. (Gift from Samuel V. Hoffman, 22 November 1924.)

 Boat Revenue 2 29 1850 Scope and Contents note

Receipt of articles shipped on board Boat Revenue of the Fultonville and NY Canal Line.

 Sloop Richard Alfred 2 30 1805 Scope and Contents note

Particulars of the Capture of Sloop Richard Alfred by Privateer Schooner under French Colors sailing from New Providence bound for New York. (Gift from John Neafie, 29 March 1922.)

 Sloop Rising Sun 2 31 1797 Scope and Contents note

Bill of Lading; Thomas Davenport, Master of Sloop Rising Sun.

 Convoy of the Roman Emperor 2 32 undated Scope and Contents note

Signals and Signal flags to be observed by the convoy of the Roman Emperor. (Gift of Graham Brush, care of City Bank & Farmers Trust Co., 21 March 1939.)

 Steamer Rosedale 2 33 1919, 1943 Scope and Contents note

Correspondence regarding the Matter of Satisfactory Reimbursement for Governmental Takeover of Steamer Rosedale. Correspondents include Acting Secretary of the Navy Franklin D. Roosevelt, William J. Fredericks, John R. Westwood, George P. Darrow, and Josephus Daniels. Contains Presidential signature.

 Sloop Royal Charlotte 2 34 1779 Scope and Contents note

Robert White, Master of Royal Charlotte, or in case of death, Daniel Stuvant, or in case of death, Alexander Craig; Royal License proving ownership in light of French hostilities. (Purchase? 23 March 1950.)

 U.S. Revenue Cutter Rush 2 35 1838 Scope and Contents note

Weekly Reports of U.S. Revenue Cutter Rush for September 1838. (Gift from Robert Fridenburg, 1 July 1933.)

 U.S.S. St. Paul 2 36 1898 Scope and Contents note

Morning Reports of prisoners in the brig on the U.S.S. St. Paul, May-August 1898 (Gift of Chas. A. Butler, 11 November 1898.)

 Brig. Sally 2 37 1792 Scope and Contents note

[Photostat] Report of Manifest of the Cargo of the Brig Sally (of Philadelphia), Michael Alcon, Master, from the Port of St. Eustatius.

 Sloop Sally 2 38 1796 Scope and Contents note

Report of Manifest of the Cargo of Sloop Sally (of Baltimore), George Travis, Master, from Port of Tappahannock to Port of New York. (Purchased from Charles F. Heartman, 19 May 1931.)

 Steamer Sarah Sands 2 39 1850 Scope and Contents note

Joseph Wrigley's Book of voyage on Steamer Sarah Sands from Rio to San Francisco. (Gift of Thomas W. Streeter, October 1963?)

 Schuyler's Steam Tow Boat Line 2 40 1847-1881 Scope and Contents note

Corporate Documents relating to the Schuyler's Steam Tow Boat Line (Samuel Schuyler), including stock certificates, stock sales, and articles of association. Bills of sales of ships. Also certificate of incorporation and other documents related to the Express Propeller Line. (Gift from Samuel V. Hoffman, 29 September 1911.)

 Schooner Shepherdess. Oversize Oversize - Small - 1811 Scope and Contents note

Crew List (Role D'Equipage) for Schooner Shepherdess, Daniel Hull Master. (Gift from Samuel V. Hoffman, 16 October 1923.)

 Ship Sincerity 2 41 1810 Scope and Contents note

Bill of Lading for Ship Sincerity, Master John Tatem, from Port of Christianstade bound for Philadelphia.

 U.S.S. Somers 2 42 1842, 1846 Scope and Contents note

Correspondence of John F. Steele to Father regarding loss of U.S. Brig Somers and 39 men off the Coast of Vera Cruz, 1846. (From the Naval History Society collection.) Correspondence of Findlay Schenck to sister, Elizabeth, regarding foiled mutiny upon U.S.S. Somers, 1842. (Gift from the Historical and Philosophical Society of Ohio, 30 November 1962.)

 Brig. Somerset 2 43 1794 Scope and Contents note

Insurance Policy covering vessel and cargo of Brig Somerset, Henry Rogers, Master on voyage to Kingston, Jamaica and return. (Gift from Samuel V. Hoffman, 24 April 1909.)

 Brig. Speedwell 2 44 1784 Scope and Contents note

Invoice of Sundries Shipped on board Brig Speedwell, Captain Welch, Bound from New York to Barbados. (Purchase?)

 Schooner Star 2 45 1851 Scope and Contents note

Bill of Lading for Schooner Star bound from Philadelphia to Providence. (Gift of Thomas Ollive Mabbott, 8 May 1942.)

 Brig. Susanna 2 46 1788 Scope and Contents note

Insurance Policy covering vessel and cargo of Brig Susanna, Hugh Stocker, Master, for 12 month period. (Purchase, 20 September 1923.)

 Ship Teaplant 2 47 1812 Scope and Contents note

Entry of Teas Imported by Edmund Fanning in the Ship Teaplant, Peter Murphy Master, from Canton.

 Brig. Thule 2 48 1825-1826 Scope and Contents note

Survey of Damage by Dock Wardens of Brig Thule, Captain Sullivan, from Carnarven, Wales. (Gift? of Roger Butterfield, July 1979.)

 Ship Titanic 2 49 1912 Scope and Contents note

Correspondence of Walford Brothers, London to R. Lyman, Esq. regarding shipped items that may have gone down with the Titanic. (Gift from Susan E. Lyman, in memory of her father Robert Hunt Lyman, 9 September 1941.)

 Port of Troy, New York 2 50 1869 Scope and Contents note

Surveyor Certificate of Canal and River Boat Wrecker No. 2. (Gift from Samuel V. Hoffman?, 5 December 1923.)

 Steamer Virginia 2 51 1851 Scope and Contents note

Bill of Lading of Steamer Virginia, Master Seal, bound from Philadelphia to Richmond. (Gift from Thomas Ollive Mabbott, 24 June 1938.)

 U.S. Revenue Cutter Washington 2 52 1839 Scope and Contents note

Weekly Reports of U.S. Revenue Cutter Washington for November and December 1839. (Gift from Robert Fridenburg, 1 July 1933.)

 Ship Washington 2 53 1799 Scope and Contents note

Bill of Lading of Ship Washington, James J. Coffin, Master, bound from New York to Liverpool. Receipt of payment United States Revenue Boat; Collector of Customs for the District of Salem (1847).

 Schooner The William. Oversize Oversize - Small - 1809 Scope and Contents note

Presidential permission (James Madison) for Schooner The William and Master John Valentine bound from New York to St. Bartholomew to depart. Multi-lingual form. Contains Presidential signature. (Gift from George A. Zabriskie, 4 March 1947.)

 Brig. Windmill 2 54 1762 Scope and Contents note

Correspondence of Gerard Beekman to Mr. Christopher Champlin (Merchant of Rhode Island) regarding Insurance for voyage of Brig Windmill, George Crosswell, Master, bound from Rhode Island to The Cape.

 Various Ships ("Hudson River Ships") 2 55 1837-1882 Scope and Contents Note

Bills of Lading for ships lying in the port of Eddyville, Rondout, N.Y. and bound for various cities, bearing cement from the Newark and Rosendale Lime & Cement Co.: Barge Tupper, Barge Samuel Cox, Barge Mary, Sloop Liberator, Sloop Ransom, Sloop Ambassador, Sloop Mammouth, Sloop Index, Sloop Lafayette, Sloop Y.W. Jacobs, Sloop Franklin, Sloop Shepherdess, Boat 363, Boat New Jersey of Eddyville, Boat Hellen, Boat L.A. Sikis, Boat Amos Stacey, Schooner Celeste, Schooner E.M. Bransconi, and Schooner Lauretta. (Gift from Samuel V. Hoffman, 5 December 1923.)

 Various Ships (Import Certifications) 2 56 1820, 1822, 1825, 1827-1828 Scope and Contents Note

Includes import certifications from the Port of New-York for the ships Superb (Ayman, Master, from Bermuda with Jamaica rum), China (Dowdall, Master, from Canton with Hyson tea), Ajax (Dowdall, Master, from Canton with Bohea tea), Maria (Evans, Master, from Canton with tea), Mary Lord (Ansley, Master, from Canton with Bohea tea), Superior (Dowdall, Master, from Canton with gunpowder tea). (Many stamped as from the Harrold E. Gillingham Collection, 14 January 1937).
